evolution.description: Elekid can evolve into Electabuzz at level 8 and above if its Loyalty level is +2 or higher. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Electric Pokémon. Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokémon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.

abilities.name: Static
abilities.description: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a result of 4, the attacker takes an amount of electric damage equal to this Pokemon's proficiency bonus.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: This Pokémon cannot be put to sleep.

items.name: Magby

evolution.description: Magby can evolve into Magmar at level 8 and above if its Loyalty level is +2 or higher. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Live Coal Pokémon. Magby's state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the Pokémon is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.

abilities.name: Flame Body
abilities.description: The flames from this Pokémon's body shine dim light in a 15 ft radius. In addition, when hit by a melee attack, roll a d10. On a 10, the attacker is burned.

abilities.name: Vital Spirit
abilities.description: This Pokémon cannot be put to sleep.

items.name: Miltank
items.description: The Milk Cow Pokémon. Miltank gives over five gallons of milk on a daily basis. Its sweet milk is enjoyed by children and grown-ups alike. People who can't drink milk turn it into yogurt and eat it instead.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.description: This Pokemon takes half the damage it otherwise would from Ice and Fire damage.

abilities.name: Scrappy
abilities.description: This Pokémon's Normal and Fighting type moves ignore immunities granted by a Pokémon's type. If a target’s secondary type gives it vulnerability or resistance to the attack, it follows the secondary type for that effect.

abilities.name: Sap Sipper
abilities.description: This Pokémon takes no damage from grass-type attacks. If hit by a grass type move, it takes no damage and instead absorbs the energy, granting advantage on its next attack.

items.name: Blissey
items.description: The Happiness Pokémon. Blissey senses sadness with its fluffy coat of fur. If it does so, this Pokémon will rush over to a sad person, no matter how far away, to share a Lucky Egg that brings a smile to any face.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.description: This Pokémon is cured of negative status ailments upon returning to its Pokeball.

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.description: The Move DC to pass a saving throw against one of this Pokémon's moves is increased by 1.

abilities.name: Healer
abilities.description: As an action, this Pokemon may touch a creature to heal poison, burn, or paralysis. When it uses this ability, roll a d4. On the a result of 1 or 2, the status effect is moved to itself.

items.name: Raikou
items.description: The Thunder Pokémon. Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly (non-area of effect moves) reduces its PP by two when activated.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.

items.name: Entei
items.description: The Volcano Pokémon. Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly (non-area of effect moves) reduces its PP by two when activated.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.

items.name: Suicune
items.description: The Aurora Pokémon. Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly (non-area of effect moves) reduces its PP by two when activated.

abilities.name: Inner Focus
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.

items.name: Larvitar

evolution.description: Larvitar can evolve into Pupitar at level 8 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 5 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Rock Skin Pokémon. Larvitar is born deep under the ground. To come up to the surface, this Pokémon must eat its way through the soil above. Until it does so, Larvitar cannot see its parents.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: When this Pokémon is burned or poisoned, they are not affected by the disadvantage or reduced damage effects. They still take damage at the end of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Sand Veil
abilities.description: This Pokémon is immune to Sandstorm damage. In addition, its AC increases by 2 in desert terrain, or during a Sandstorm.

items.name: Pupitar

evolution.description: Pupitar can evolve into Tyranitar at level 16 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 15 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

items.description: The Hard Shell Pokémon. Pupitar creates a gas inside its body that it compresses and forcefully ejects to propel itself like a jet. The body is very durable-it avoids damage even if it hits solid steel.

abilities.name: Shed Skin
abilities.description: If this Pokémon is affected by a negative status ailment, they can roll a d4 at the end of each of their turns. On a result of 4, they are cured.

items.name: Tyranitar
items.description: The Armor Pokémon. Tyranitar is so overwhelmingly powerful, it can bring down a whole mountain to make its nest. This Pokémon wanders about in mountains seeking new opponents to fight.

abilities.name: Sand Stream
abilities.description: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to a Sandstorm for 5 rounds. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.

abilities.name: Unnerve
abilities.description: Opponents in combat with this Pokémon cannot eat held berries.

items.name: Lugia
items.description: The Diving Pokémon. Lugia's wings pack devastating power-a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly (non-area of effect moves) reduces its PP by two when activated.

abilities.name: Multiscale
abilities.description: If this Pokémon is at full health, the first damage dealt to it is halved.

items.name: Ho-oh
items.description: The Rainbow Pokémon. Ho-Oh's feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.description: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly (non-area of effect moves) reduces its PP by two when activated.

abilities.name: Regenerator
abilities.description: Once per long rest, this Pokémon regains hit points equal to its level when it returns to its Pokéball.

items.name: Celebi
items.description: The Time Travel Pokémon. This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.description: This Pokémon is cured of negative status ailments upon returning to its Pokeball.
